Description:
Contemporary Living Opposite Parklands
The clean lines of contemporary living are elegantly displayed throughout this three bedroom two bathroom townhouse boasting quality appointments. Featuring formal and informal living zones showcasing lustrous timber floors, this elegant residence boasts a superb Caesarstone kitchen featuring stainless steel appliances and endless counter space, perfectly positioned to service the low maintenance rear courtyard for seamless indoor-outdoor living. Double bedrooms with BIR's are complemented by a spacious family bathroom, the master enjoying WIR's and ensuite with spa bath, while ducted heating, split systems and a single garage with remote and internal entry assure comfort and security. Enviably positioned opposite a park and moments to bustling Sydney Road, trams, Batman Station, Upfield Bike Path, Coburg Lake Reserve and schools, inspection will impress.
Insights: 16 Tanderum Drive, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Character Filled Home!
There is plenty to love about this beautifully presented family home. If lifestyle and comfort is a requirement then this property is a must see. You will be greeted by your own private garden oasis with a multitude of additional features.
Great for entertaining, boasting a light filled living area with polished timber floors adjoining the kitchen/dining area featuring a dishwasher, gas cook top, oven and an abundance of cupboard and bench space. Leading out to your own large outdoor undercover entertaining area with a beautiful Gazebo perfect for your morning coffee, large rear yard including courtyard access to the family friendly Coburg Bush Reserve.
Offering four large size bedrooms all with built in wardrobes, master bedroom includes ensuite, the second large bedroom features a double built in wardrobe. Serviced by a spacious central bathroom including a spa bath, a separate shower and a separate toilet.
Complementing this character filled home is a large separate laundry with plenty of storage, high ceilings, central heating, single garage and three off street car spaces. With easy access to everything Coburg has to enjoy, such as Sydney Road and Melville Road popular restaurants and cafes. Within walking distance to all public transport options such as bus stops, Coburg Train Station and local schools such as Coburg North Primary School, Coburg West Primary School and Coburg High School.
This is a property not too be missed!
Insights: 49 other 4 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Classic Californian with Room to Move!
A terrific opportunity to secure your family's future in the prized Strathmore Secondary College zone, this attractive period home presents an environment of immediate comfort and convenience along with endless potential to further enhance and expand (STCA). On a deep block surrounded by established gardens, the home's spotless interior comprises two large bedrooms and modern central bathroom, study/sunroom, separate lounge and kitchen/meals. Other highlights include gas heating and split-system a/c, high ceilings, solar power, plus an expansive backyard complete with undercover patio, bungalow and garage (remote-controlled) to ROW. Walking distance to Reynard Street buses and Melville Road trams, popular primary schools, it's also close to Coburg Station, renowned shopping precinct, access to airports and CBD via freeway/Citylink.
Insights: 18 Bruce Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 58 other 2 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Undeniable allure
A revelation in a peaceful court location, this superbly presented three bedroom, two bathroom residence elegantly combines style with substance. Featuring a beautifully presented living room, smart and spacious kitchen/dining, entertainer's courtyard and retreat, it's a stroll to trams, De Chene Reserve, Coburg High, and close to popular Sydney Road. The modern kitchen features a stone benchtop with appliances including a brand-new induction cooktop, fan-forced oven and dishwasher. Each of the three double bedrooms offers a BIR or WIR, plus two gleaming bathrooms with an ensuite, and top extras include bespoke joinery throughout with ample storage, powder room, reverse-cycle heating/cooling, plantation shutters, eye-catching light fittings, irrigation system, side gate access, auto garage and second parking space.
Insights: 4 Parklane Mews, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
UNDER OFFER - Smart and spacious with perfect park views
In a secluded Coburg cul-de-sac with uninterrupted views to Merri Creek and surrounding parkland, this three-level townhouse is sure to impress with its versatile floorplan, quality features and abundance of natural light throughout. Impeccable interior comprises three bedrooms (or two bedrooms and second living area), stylish bathroom and additional powder room (second WC), open-plan lounge/dining enhanced by a modern stone-top kitchen with soft-close drawers and Smeg/Bosch appliances. Add to this heating and cooling, full-size laundry, off-street parking space, plus undercover terrace and upstairs balcony to enjoy the leafy outlook. Blissfully quiet yet incredibly convenient, it's also walking distance to Nicholson Street trams, local cafes, as well as easy access to schools, popular restaurants and renowned shopping precincts.
Insights: 2 Berg Place, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
SOLD BY THE TEAM AT STOCKDALE & LEGGO GLADSTONE PARK
With the ambience and size of a modern terrace, this spacious two-level contemporary townhouse is private, luxurious and an opportunity not to be missed.
Perfectly positioned only 8km from the city, the 'Pentridge Piazza' has made a defining contribution in transforming Coburg into what is now one of the most sought after and trendiest suburbs in Melbourne.
This very desirable residence features heating and cooling, a spacious open living and dining area, well-appointed kitchen with plenty of storage, euro-laundry and an impressive terrace which makes the perfect setting to relax or entertain in.
On the first floor the property includes two large bedrooms, a master bedroom with city views, walk in robes and a modern en-suite bathroom, private study nook and stylish main bathroom. With added extra of 2 x undercover remote control car parks with 2 x storage cages.
With local parklands, cafes, shops and markets, as well as sporting and recreational facilities and easy access to trams and trains (1km walk to Batman Station) you will very quickly see why so many are moving North to Coburg.
Currently tenanted on a fixed term lease at $1712.00 until September 2018.
Photo ID required at inspections.
Insights: 6/6 Industry Lane, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 58 other 2 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Lifestyle Success Made Simple
Enjoying the exclusivity of an address shared by only four others, sought-after street frontage precedes a home of sensational contemporary appeal and style. Abundant light illuminates generous living proportions where delightful private courtyard provides added indoor/outdoor allure. The kitchen is superbly sized, equipped with gas cooking and extensive bench space while making space for meals. Upstairs two brilliantly sized bedrooms are each bright and airy, and accompanied by central bathroom that reflects the home's commitment to modern comfort. Further features include built-in-robes in both bedrooms, euro laundry, downstairs powder room, split system heating/cooling in living area and covered car space accessed from Sutherland St. The nearness of trains, city-bound trams on Sydney Rd and Merri Creek walking and cycling trails emphasise lifestyle satisfaction.
Insights: 1/39 Service Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 58 other 2 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
EXPRESSION OF INTEREST CLOSES 26/09/17 AT 6PM
A True Classic
Tranquillity tucked away yet only moments to Melville Road/Bell Street retail junction and tram, this two bedroom 594m2 Californian Bungalow boasts period charm and Strathmore College zoning. Leadlight windows enhance a classic façade concealing high decorative ceilings and polished Baltic pine floorboards. An elegant hallway accesses generous bedrooms (one with BIRs, another with bay window) and a central lounge, warmed by a traditional fireplace with overmantle. The large kitchen with breakfast bar leads to an open dining zone overlooking a family room/retreat. Beyond, a covered outdoor entertaining area permits year round use. Theres also a driveway, carport and garage parking, a separate workshop, ducted heating, air conditioning and second toilet. Ideal for families with potential to renovate, extend or rebuild (STCA).
Insights: 58 other 2 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Victorian Character, Finessed for Families
A quaint facade belies the generous proportions of this grandly updated Victorian boasting three large bedrooms with a fourth bedroom/study. A sympathetic fusion of old and new this immaculate home impresses with its period details and extended living spaces. Enter this stately home where lofty decorative ceilings, superb timber floors and an arched hallway adorned with chandeliers introduces three bedrooms and a bathroom before giving way to expansive open plan living where a huge island kitchen takes centre stage. Boasting endless storage, 900mm cooking and dramatic black tile splashbacks it forms the heart of this home, and is well positioned to service the paved rear entertainer's garden and a private side courtyard for a relaxed indoor/outdoor lifestyle. A final bedroom and luxurious second bathroom boasting generous spa bath and double vanity complete this home that also boasts decorative fireplaces, ducted heating/cooling and a double tandem garage with remote door. All this moments from choice of transport, schools, local shopping and bustling Sydney Road.
Insights: 13 Shackell Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Family Focus with Position and Potential
In a prized Coburg pocket just north of Brunswick's border, this captivating double-front Victorian provides a lifestyle opportunity of immediate enjoyment and versatility along with exciting options to further enhance and extend (STCA). Beyond its private front garden and gorgeous facade, the home's generous interior comprises three large bedrooms (two with BIRs) and contemporary bathroom with spa bath and frameless shower, central lounge through to the updated kitchen with Smeg appliances (including induction cooktop) and adjoining dining room. Other features include ducted heating and split-system a/c, open fireplaces, polished floorboards and high pressed-metal ceilings (hallway, lounge and all bedrooms), alarm and video intercom, plus laundry/second WC, large undercover entertaining area and expansive north-facing backyard with workshop/storeroom. Complete with secure two-car off-street parking (remote-controlled gate), it's walking distance to trams and trains, local schools, cool cafes, renowned restaurants and popular shopping precincts. Land 518sqms approx. Zoning NRZ1.

Description:
Country Serenity With Urban Convenience
Enjoying the greenery and tranquillity of the Newlands Estate Precinct, this classic, three bedroom, solid red clinker brick home is superbly positioned on a generous allotment opposite Merri Creek Trail parkland.
An elevated aspect assures a panoramic view from several rooms, sure to impress new buyers, investors and downsizers seeking country serenity with urban convenience.
The floor plan is traditional in nature, complementing three well scaled bedrooms (two with a full wall of floor-to-ceiling built-in wardrobes).
Appreciating the vista opposite, the sun-filled lounge is lined with timber floorboards and embellished with a rosette ceiling.
Meanwhile, the adjoining blackwood kitchen includes space for family meals.
A large covered area welcomes outdoor entertaining, overlooking pretty landscaped gardens basking in abundant light provided by a north easterly aspect.
Additional features include a fully tiled central bathroom, laundry, good storage, gas heating, external security shutters and driveway parking.
In additional to enjoying the natural setting at your door, it is also conveniently placed near Coburg High School, local sporting facilities, Nicholson Street Tram plus Sydney Road shops and cafes.
Insights: 85 Connolly Avenue, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Space & Location will impress.
Located on the second level in a block of eight, this bright and spacious one bedroom apartment is only a short stroll to cosmopolitan Sydney Road shops, cafes and public transport. Perfect inner city living and filled with natural light, this apartment has a galley style kitchen, inviting open plan living area, access to balcony with awesome views to the city, spacious bedroom with built in robe and central bathroom. Completing this are shared laundry facilities, secure entry and secure undercover carspace making this attractive for the investor or excellent entry level opportunity. Currently leased until March 2018.
Insights: 5/44 Munro Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2020 and 26 other 1 bedroom unit in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
A timeless contemporary masterpiece
Renovated in outstanding style beyond a 1920s façade, this impressively spacious residence has been cleverly designed to capture the golden past and the modern today for low maintenance living close to schools, transport, shops & parkland. With an abundance of light throughout the entire home, the floor plan incorporates 4 double BRs (elegant ensuite & dressing room to main), generous expansive light filled open plan family, living and kitchen area with butler’s pantry, luxurious family bathroom (freestanding bath, walk-in shower) powder room & laundry.
Including an extensive decking and BBQ entertaining area and off street parking, this polished home features ducted vacuum, split a/c throughout the home and stone bench tops.
Inspection is a must!
Insights: 52 Stawell Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
"Loch" it in!
Walking distance to Coburg Train Station, Coburg Shopping Centre, Sydney Road cafes, Upfield Bike Path and Robinson Reserve, this updated two bedroom plus study townhouse offers a lifestyle of comfort and convenience. A central staircase separates lounge from kitchen/meals areas whilst permitting free flow and north facing light, also enjoyed from a pleasant courtyard. The kitchen boasts a full suite of stainless steel appliances and ample storage. Upstairs, sky-lit vaulted ceilings add architectural flair. The bedrooms (BIRs) share a stylish near new bathroom which incorporates laundry function. Enhancing new buyer and investor appeal are new carpets, fresh paint, ceiling fans plus carport.
Insights: 2/22 Loch Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 58 other 2 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Style, Comfort, Ease
Featuring street frontage in an exceptionally convenient cul-de-sac, moments to cosmopolitan Sydney Road and Coburg Market, this contemporary three bedroom residence flaunts a private northerly courtyard. Presenting an open kitchen/meals/living, plus space to entertain outdoors, it's easy to look after and even easier to enjoy. Boasting stainless steel Blanco appliances and a dishwasher, the kitchen is completed by dark mosaic tiled splashbacks, cupboards and expansive counters. Bright double bedrooms include a spacious ground floor room and two above: one with a walk-in robe and mountain glimpses, and another with built-in robe. The bathroom comes with a relaxing bath, separate shower, toilet and vanity with semi-recessed basin, complemented by a second toilet and full laundry. Further features include panel heaters, split system heating and cooling, a large under stair storage area and automatic garage with interior and courtyard access. A short stroll to trams, trains, reserves, shops, cafes and restaurants, and close to schools, the locale is fittingly attractive too.
Insights: 9A Methven Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2017 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.
